original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: 'o na dus gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dus gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the proper time?

original: de'i phyir 'di smas pa yin te /🔽grang ba las byung nyes tshogs dpyid kyi tshe //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di smas pa yin te / grang ba las byung nyes tshogs dpyid kyi tshe //
translated: Therefore, this is said:🔽The host of faults arising from cold in spring,

original: rnam bsal so ga las byung dbyar dus na //
analyzed: rnam bsal so ga las byung dbyar dus na //
translated: the faults arising from summer in the summer,

original: dbyar bsags sprin bral dus su legs sbyangs na //
analyzed: dbyar bsags sprin bral dus su legs sbyangs na //
translated: having been well purified in the cloudless season,

original: dus byung nad ni nam yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: dus byung nad ni nam yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: diseases arising from the seasons will never occur.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: grang ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgun stod dang / dgun smad gnyi ga gzung ngo //
analyzed: grang ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgun stod dang / dgun smad gnyi ga gzung ngo //
translated: The term “cold” refers to both the early and late winter seasons.

original: nyes ba rnams kyi tshogs yin pas na nyes tshogs te /🔽de ltar grang ba las byung zhing skyes pa'i nyes ba'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni dpyid kyi tshe rnam par bsal zhing bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyes ba rnams kyi tshogs yin pas na nyes tshogs te / de ltar grang ba las byung zhing skyes pa'i nyes ba'i tshogs gang yin pa de ni dpyid kyi tshe rnam par bsal zhing bsal bar bya'o //
translated: The term “collection of faults” means a collection of faults.🔽Thus, the collection of faults that arise and occur in the cold season should be removed and eliminated in the spring.

original: de bzhin du so ga'i tsho bsags pa las byung ba'i nyes pa'i tshogs ni dbyar gyi dus na rnam par sbyang bar bya'o //🔽de bzhin du dbyar bsags pa'i nyes pa rnams ni sprin bral dus te /
analyzed: de bzhin du so ga'i tsho bsags pa las byung ba'i nyes pa'i tshogs ni dbyar gyi dus na rnam par sbyang bar bya'o // de bzhin du dbyar bsags pa'i nyes pa rnams ni sprin bral dus te /
translated: In the same way, the collection of faults that arise from the accumulation in the winter season should be purified in the summer.🔽In the same way, the faults that accumulate in the summer should be quickly and rapidly removed in the autumn season, which is free of clouds.

original: ston gyi dus su myur zhing rings pa gso dpyad kyi bstan bcos las byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du legs par sbyangs shing rnam par bsal na /
analyzed: ston gyi dus su myur zhing rings pa gso dpyad kyi bstan bcos las byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du legs par sbyangs shing rnam par bsal na /
translated: If one properly removes and eliminates them according to the procedures found in the treatises on medicine,

original: dus las byung ba'i nad skyes bu de la nam yang 'byung zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus las byung ba'i nad skyes bu de la nam yang 'byung zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the diseases that arise from the seasons will never occur or arise in that person.

original: dpyid kyi tshe rnam bsal zhes smos pa 'dir ni dpyid zla 'bring po mgo zug pa kho na'i dus su sbyang bar bya ba yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: dpyid kyi tshe rnam bsal zhes smos pa 'dir ni dpyid zla 'bring po mgo zug pa kho na'i dus su sbyang bar bya ba yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: The statement in spring, the time of purification should be understood to refer to the time when the middle month of spring begins.

original: de ltar ma byas na bzlog dka' ba'i nyes pa yod de /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na bzlog dka' ba'i nyes pa yod de /
translated: If it were not so, there would be the fault of difficulty in reversing.

original: dus gnyis po 'di la bsags pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs sbyang bar bya ba'i dus la bab pa dag ni dus gzhan dag la bsdad pa na bsal bar dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽so ga las byung dbyar dus na //
analyzed: dus gnyis po 'di la bsags pa'i nyes pa'i tshogs sbyang bar bya ba'i dus la bab pa dag ni dus gzhan dag la bsdad pa na bsal bar dka' ba yin pa'i phyir ro // so ga las byung dbyar dus na //
translated: The collection of faults accumulated in these two times, when the time for purification has arrived, is difficult to remove if one waits for another time.

original: zhes bya ba'i skabs 'dir yang dbyar gyi dus rtsom pa nyid na yin par bya zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skabs 'dir yang dbyar gyi dus rtsom pa nyid na yin par bya zhing /
translated: The statement in summer, the time of origination should be understood to refer to the time when the summer season begins.

original: ji srid grang ba dang / rlung dang / ba mo dang / char gyi rgyun dang / 'dres pa'i dus sum phyin par bya ba yin no //🔽dbyar bsags sprin bral dus zhes bya ba 'dis /
analyzed: ji srid grang ba dang / rlung dang / ba mo dang / char gyi rgyun dang / 'dres pa'i dus sum phyin par bya ba yin no // dbyar bsags sprin bral dus zhes bya ba 'dis /
translated: One should remain until the time of cold, wind, fog, rain, and mixed weather has passed.

original: dus gang gi tshe sprin dang shin tu bral zhing /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe sprin dang shin tu bral zhing /
translated: The statement in autumn, the time of cloudlessness refers to the time when clouds have completely disappeared.

original: nam mkha' dang bar gyur pa ste /🔽ston zla gnyis kyi phyi ma'i cha /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang bar gyur pa ste / ston zla gnyis kyi phyi ma'i cha /
translated: The second half of the last two months of autumn is the time of the sky.🔽The last month of autumn is to be understood as the time of the sky.

original: ston zla tha chungs yin par shes bar bya'i mgo rtsom pa la ni mi bzung ngo //
analyzed: ston zla tha chungs yin par shes bar bya'i mgo rtsom pa la ni mi bzung ngo //
translated: But it is not to be taken as the beginning of the season.

original: de skad du gzhung rtsom par byed pas kyang /🔽dbyar dang ston zla @50a * //
analyzed: de skad du gzhung rtsom par byed pas kyang / dbyar dang ston zla @50a * //
translated: The author of the treatise also says:🔽The last two months of autumn and winter

original: chungs dpyid 'bring //
analyzed: chungs dpyid 'bring //
translated: and the middle month of spring

original: zla ba rim bzhin thun mong yin //
analyzed: zla ba rim bzhin thun mong yin //
translated: are the common times for the three humors.

original: so ga dbyar dgun la bsags pa'i //
analyzed: so ga dbyar dgun la bsags pa'i //
translated: In the spring, summer and winter,

original: rlung la sogs pa myur du bsal //🔽zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa myur du bsal // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: the wind and so forth are quickly removed.

original: ji ltar na mi rnams rtag tu nad med par 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rnams rtag tu nad med par 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: In order to show how people can always be free from illness, it is said:

original: rtag tu phan pa'i zas dang spyod lam bsten //
analyzed: rtag tu phan pa'i zas dang spyod lam bsten //
translated: Always rely on beneficial food and conduct,

original: brtags te byed cing yul rnams la mi chags //
analyzed: brtags te byed cing yul rnams la mi chags //
translated: act after examination and do not be attached to objects.

original: gtong ldan sems snyoms bden brtson bzod dang ldan //
analyzed: gtong ldan sems snyoms bden brtson bzod dang ldan //
translated: Be generous, impartial, truthful, diligent, patient

original: nyams ldan sten par byed na nad med gyur //
analyzed: nyams ldan sten par byed na nad med gyur //
translated: and rely on those with experience and you will be free from illness.

original: zhes bya ba ni yon tan di lta bu dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni nad med cing tha mal par bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yon tan di lta bu dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni nad med cing tha mal par bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is endowed with such qualities will be free from illness and will live a long and happy life.

original: de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang rtag tu zhes pa dus thams cad du phan zhing 'phrod pa'i zas dang / spyod lam bsten zhing goms par byed ba ste /
analyzed: gang rtag tu zhes pa dus thams cad du phan zhing 'phrod pa'i zas dang / spyod lam bsten zhing goms par byed ba ste /
translated: It is the food and conduct that are always beneficial and suitable, which are relied upon and cultivated.

original: phan pa'i zas ni 'og nas bshad pa dang / dus su spyad pa'i le'u las bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i zas ni 'og nas bshad pa dang / dus su spyad pa'i le'u las bshad par bya'o //
translated: Beneficial food will be explained below and in the chapter on timely conduct.

original: spyod lam ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun tu spyod pa ste /
analyzed: spyod lam ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun tu spyod pa ste /
translated: Conduct is the complete conduct of body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang nyin re brtag par spyad pa'i le'u las bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang nyin re brtag par spyad pa'i le'u las bshad pa yin te /
translated: That is explained in the chapter on daily practice.

original: de dag la brten pa dang / de bzhin du brtags te byed cing zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag la brten pa dang / de bzhin du brtags te byed cing zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Relying on those and likewise examining and acting means

original: gang dang gang byed pa de dang de spang ba dang blang bar bya ba legs par brtags shing byed de /
analyzed: gang dang gang byed pa de dang de spang ba dang blang bar bya ba legs par brtags shing byed de /
translated: that whatever one does, one should do it after properly examining what should be adopted and what should be rejected.

original: 'di byas na ni rdzogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di byas na ni rdzogs par 'gyur la /
translated: If one does this, it will be completed.

original: 'di byas na ni mi rdzogs shing mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa de ltar shes par byas nas /
analyzed: 'di byas na ni mi rdzogs shing mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa de ltar shes par byas nas /
translated: Knowing that if one does this, one will not complete and perfect the practice,🔽one should engage in virtue and abandon nonvirtue.

original: dge ba byed cing mi dge ba spong bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du yul rnams la mi chags zhes pa ste /🔽gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri la sogs pa la sems chags pa med pa dang / gtong ldan zhes pa gtong zhing sbyin par byed pa'i ngang tshul can dang / sems snyoms zhes pa sems can thams cad nye dur gyur cing rjes su chags pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba byed cing mi dge ba spong bar byed pa dang / de bzhin du yul rnams la mi chags zhes pa ste / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri la sogs pa la sems chags pa med pa dang / gtong ldan zhes pa gtong zhing sbyin par byed pa'i ngang tshul can dang / sems snyoms zhes pa sems can thams cad nye dur gyur cing rjes su chags pa dang /
translated: Likewise, one should not be attached to objects,🔽that is, one should not be attached to forms, sounds, smells, and so forth.🔽One should be generous, that is, be of a disposition to give and to share.

original: khong khro ba med pa dang / bden brtson zhes pa bden pa gtso bor lhur byed cing /
analyzed: khong khro ba med pa dang / bden brtson zhes pa bden pa gtso bor lhur byed cing /
translated: One should be impartial, that is, one should be even-minded toward all sentient beings, regarding them as one’s relatives, without attachment and anger.

original: bden par dam 'cha' la /🔽slu ba med pa'i tshig phyin ci ma log par smra ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan zhes pa ste /
analyzed: bden par dam 'cha' la / slu ba med pa'i tshig phyin ci ma log par smra ba dang / bzod pa dang ldan zhes pa ste /
translated: One should be truthful, that is, one should be committed to the truth,🔽and one should speak unmistaken and undeceptive words.

original: bzod cing des pa'i ngang tshul can dang / de bzhin du nyams ldan sten par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bzod cing des pa'i ngang tshul can dang / de bzhin du nyams ldan sten par byed pa ste /
translated: One should be patient, that is, one should be of a disposition that is patient and tolerant.🔽Likewise, one should rely on those who are experienced.

original: mkhas pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas na mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i ngang tshul can yin pas na mkhas pa ste /
translated: He is wise because he has the nature of being wise.

original: 'jig rten gnyi ga la slu ba med cing @50b chags pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa'i dngos po mthong ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnyi ga la slu ba med cing @50b chags pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa'i dngos po mthong ba la mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called wise in seeing things that are nondeceptive, nonattached, and nonviolent in both worlds.

original: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas /🔽gang zhig dus gsum dri med par //
analyzed: de yang drang srong tsa ra kas / gang zhig dus gsum dri med par //
translated: The sage Caraka says:🔽He who knows the three times

original: shes shing rtag tu ma nyams pa //
analyzed: shes shing rtag tu ma nyams pa //
translated: without error and always without decline

original: de mkhas phul byung blo rgyas yin //
analyzed: de mkhas phul byung blo rgyas yin //
translated: is the most wise, his mind expanded.

original: de'i tshig the tshom med cing bsten //
analyzed: de'i tshig the tshom med cing bsten //
translated: His words are without doubt and are to be relied upon.

original: skyon bral rmongs pa med pa ste //
analyzed: skyon bral rmongs pa med pa ste //
translated: He is free of faults and is not confused.

original: mi bden par ni ji ltar smra //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mi bden par ni ji ltar smra // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: How could he speak falsely?

original: mkhas shing lung dang ldan pa de la brten na nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas shing lung dang ldan pa de la brten na nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one relies on that wise one who has scripture, one will be free of disease.

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i rnam par 'grel ba tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i rnam par 'grel ba tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
translated: This is the commentary on the meaning of the words of the Essence of Eight Branches, called “Moonlight,”

original: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam bar sbyar ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam bar sbyar ba las /
translated: composed by the master Candranandana.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the fourth chapter.

original: // / de nas chu sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag shes bar bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas chu sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag shes bar bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now the chapter on the various kinds of water, etc. should be explained.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: sngar gong du rtag tu phan pa'i zas dang spyod lam bsten na /
analyzed: sngar gong du rtag tu phan pa'i zas dang spyod lam bsten na /
translated: it was previously taught above that if one relies on food and conduct that is always beneficial,

original: nad med par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bstan la /
analyzed: nad med par 'gyur ro // zhes bstan la /
translated: one will be free from disease.

original: phan pa'i zas dang spyod lam de gnyis kyang ming tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa'i zas dang spyod lam de gnyis kyang ming tsam zhig bstan pa yin no //
translated: And that beneficial food and conduct were taught merely by name.

original: de la spyod lam ni rtsol ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / las kyi bye brag bshad pas /
analyzed: de la spyod lam ni rtsol ba la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang / las kyi bye brag bshad pas /
translated: As for conduct, its nature and the specific activities were explained,

original: phal cher bshad zin pa dang / 'og nas kyang ston to //
analyzed: phal cher bshad zin pa dang / 'og nas kyang ston to //
translated: so it has been explained for the most part and will be taught below as well.

original: zas kyis kyang rang gi ngo bo dang / las dang yon tan dag 'dir cung zad kyang ma smos so //
analyzed: zas kyis kyang rang gi ngo bo dang / las dang yon tan dag 'dir cung zad kyang ma smos so //
translated: As for food, its nature, function and qualities are not mentioned at all here.

original: de bas na da ni de'i rang go ngo bo dang las dang yon tan bshad par bya ba'i phyir dang / le'u 'di gnyis brtsams pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na da ni de'i rang go ngo bo dang las dang yon tan bshad par bya ba'i phyir dang / le'u 'di gnyis brtsams pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, now in order to explain its nature, function and qualities, and because these two chapters were composed,

original: de gnyis las kyang chu sna tshogs pa gsher ba'i rdzas kyi bye brag shes pa ni gtso bo yin pas dang por bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang chu sna tshogs pa gsher ba'i rdzas kyi bye brag shes pa ni gtso bo yin pas dang por bstan pa yin no //
translated: Of these two, the knowledge of the various kinds of water, which is a particular substance of fluidity, is the most important, and so it is taught first.

original: chu sna tshogs pa ni chu rnams dang / 'o ma dang bu ram shing gi khu ba dang / til mar dang / chang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chu sna tshogs pa ni chu rnams dang / 'o ma dang bu ram shing gi khu ba dang / til mar dang / chang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The various kinds of water are the waters, milk, sugarcane juice, sesame oil, wine, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi bye brag shes par bya ba ni phan pa dang gnod pa nyid kyis ro dang nus pa dang / 'ju ba dang yon tan la sogs pa shes shing rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bye brag shes par bya ba ni phan pa dang gnod pa nyid kyis ro dang nus pa dang / 'ju ba dang yon tan la sogs pa shes shing rtogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of their particularities is the understanding and realization of their taste, potency, digestion, qualities, and so on, through their benefit and harm.

original: de la phan zhing dgos pa ni le'u ste /
analyzed: de la phan zhing dgos pa ni le'u ste /
translated: Here, the beneficial and necessary is the chapter.

original: de bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It should be explained, is the meaning.

original: de la dang por ni chu'i yon tan gyi nges pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dang por ni chu'i yon tan gyi nges pa ston pa yin te /
translated: There, first of all, it shows the certainty of the qualities of water.

original: de ni thams cad la dgos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad la dgos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is necessary for all.

original: de yang slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon gyis /
translated: And that is stated by the master:

original: chu ni srog chags rnams kyi chogs //
analyzed: chu ni srog chags rnams kyi chogs //
translated: Water is the wealth of living beings.

original: lus kyang de yi rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: lus kyang de yi rang bzhin yin //
translated: The body also has that nature.

original: de bas shin tu dgag pa yis //
analyzed: de bas shin tu dgag pa yis //
translated: Therefore, with great restraint,

original: @51a * // chu ni gang du'ang bzlog pa med //🔽ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: @51a * // chu ni gang du'ang bzlog pa med // ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: Water is never rejected.

original: mkha' las 'bab pa'i gang g'a'i chu //
analyzed: mkha' las 'bab pa'i gang g'a'i chu //
translated: The water of the Ganges falling from the sky

original: 'tsho byed ngoms byed yi gar 'ong //
analyzed: 'tsho byed ngoms byed yi gar 'ong //
translated: is life-giving, satisfying, delightful,

original: tshim byed sems ni gsal byed la //🔽sla zhing ro mi gsal la zhim //
analyzed: tshim byed sems ni gsal byed la // sla zhing ro mi gsal la zhim //
translated: soothing, refreshing,🔽easy, not too strong, delicious,

original: bsil zhing yang ba bdud rtsir mtshungs //
analyzed: bsil zhing yang ba bdud rtsir mtshungs //
translated: cooling, light, like nectar.

original: nyi zla rlung gis reg gyur pa //🔽de yi yul dus la ltos nas //
analyzed: nyi zla rlung gis reg gyur pa // de yi yul dus la ltos nas //
translated: The wind touching the sun and moon🔽is beneficial or harmful

original: phal cher phan dang gnod pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phal cher phan dang gnod pa yin // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: depending on the place and time.

original: nam mkha' las 'bab pa'i gang g'a'i chu ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' las 'bab pa'i gang g'a'i chu ni /
translated: The water of the Ganges falling from the sky

original: yon tan 'di dag dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag dang ldan pa ste /
translated: has these qualities.

original: 'tsho byed ces bya ba mdangs 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho byed ces bya ba mdangs 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Life-giving means it increases radiance.

original: ngoms byed ni ngal ba sel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngoms byed ni ngal ba sel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Satisfying means it removes fatigue.

original: dga' bar byed pa ni snying dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa ni snying dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Delightful means it delights the heart.

original: yang na snying la phan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na snying la phan par byed pa'o //
translated: Or it benefits the heart.

original: tshim byed ni bde ba skyed pa 'am nad sel ba'o //
analyzed: tshim byed ni bde ba skyed pa 'am nad sel ba'o //
translated: Soothing means it produces pleasure or removes illness.

original: blo sad par byed pa ni shes rab kyi kha 'byed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: blo sad par byed pa ni shes rab kyi kha 'byed par byed pa ste /
translated: It is refreshing because it opens the mouth of wisdom.

original: gang la shes rab ci tsam zhig de la gsal bar snang ba nyid du de 'thungs pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang la shes rab ci tsam zhig de la gsal bar snang ba nyid du de 'thungs pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: To the extent that wisdom is present, to that extent it appears clear.

original: sla ba ni ska ba ma yin pa'o //🔽ro mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sla ba ni ska ba ma yin pa'o // ro mi gsal ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is easy to drink because it is not thick.

original: mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro de la gsal ba med pas na ro mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro de la gsal ba med pas na ro mi gsal ba'o //
translated: It is not too strong, because it is not too strong in taste.🔽It is not too weak, because it is not too weak in taste.

original: zhim pa ni ro bda' ba ste /
analyzed: zhim pa ni ro bda' ba ste /
translated: It is delicious, because it is fragrant.

original: srog chags rnams kyis shin tu sred par byas nas /
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyis shin tu sred par byas nas /
translated: It is drunk by living beings who are very thirsty.🔽It is drunk for the purpose of drinking.

original: btung ba'i don du 'thung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btung ba'i don du 'thung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de yang gang gi phyir drang srong dag gis /
